title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: Decorator function update various settings ggplot plot objects

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
code: ggplot_decorator(   output_name,   label_text = "decorator",   render_ui = c(),   plot_options = list(title = "", footnote = "", y_breaks = "", y_limits_max = "",     y_limits_min = "", x_breaks = "", x_labels_discrete = "", x_labels_cont = "",     y_labels_discrete = "", y_labels_cont = "", font_size_geom_text = "",     font_size_plot_title = "", font_size_axis_title = "", font_size_axis_text = "") )

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: output_name name output plot object. label_text Customized label text decorator render_ui Vector ggplot_options following list: "title" - Title plot, "footnote" - Footnote plot, "y_breaks" - Value breaks(numeric) y-axis. Note: y_limits_max y_limits_min also provided, "y_limits_max" - Value y-axis maximum limit(numeric). Note: y_limits_max y_breaks also provided, "y_limits_min" - Value y-axis minimum limit(numeric). Note: y_breaks y_limits_min also provided, "x_breaks"- Value breaks continuous x-axis(numeric). Note: comma separated, "x_labels_discrete" - Values labels discrete x-axis. Note: comma separated, "x_labels_cont" - Values labels continuous x-axis. Note: comma separated, "y_labels_discrete" - Values labels discrete y-axis. Note: comma separated, "y_labels_cont" - Values labels continuous y-axis. Note: comma separated, "font_size_geom_text" - Font size geom_text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_plot_title"- Font size plot title text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_axis_title"- Font size axis title text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_axis_text"- Font size axis labels text. Note: numeric value provided plot_options Named list list values ggplot options. app developer can specify required list options calling decorator.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: Returns modified plot object transformation applied.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: module creates UI text controls specifying list ggplot options given plot_options param value. entered ggplot options applied ggplot plot object.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
code: library(teal) #> Loading required package: shiny #> Loading required package: teal.data #> Loading required package: teal.code #> Loading required package: teal.slice #>  #> You are using teal version 1.0.0 #>  #> Attaching package: ‘teal’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:teal.slice’: #>  #>     as.teal_slices, teal_slices library(teal.modules.general) #> Loading required package: ggmosaic #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Loading required package: teal.transform app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),   modules = teal::modules(     teal.modules.general::tm_g_scatterplot(       x = teal.transform::data_extract_spec(         dataname = "IRIS",         select = teal.transform::select_spec(choices = teal.transform::variable_choices(iris))       ),       y = teal.transform::data_extract_spec(         dataname = "IRIS",         select = teal.transform::select_spec(choices = teal.transform::variable_choices(iris))       ),       decorators = list(         plot = ggplot_decorator(output_name = "plot", render_ui = c("title", "footnote", "font_size_axis_title"))       )     )   ) ) #> Initializing tm_g_scatterplot if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

title: Combine levels of a variable into one level — merge_levels_transformator
Combine levels of a variable into one level — merge_levels_transformator
text: dataname (character(1)) name dataset columns used possible transformation.

title: Combine levels of a variable into one level — merge_levels_transformator
text: teal::teal_transform_module

title: Combine levels of a variable into one level — merge_levels_transformator
text: transformator allows user select column dataset combine values column single level. Unselected levels unaffected. new combined level called "Combined". Merging works character factor columns.

title: Combine levels of a variable into one level — merge_levels_transformator
code: app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),   modules = teal::modules(     teal::example_module(       transformators = list(merge_levels_transformator("IRIS"))     )   ) ) if (interactive()) {   shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

what: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: transformator provides users flexible, dynamic filtering capabilities datasets. instance transformator operates single dataset. Users can define multiple filter blocks, : Conditions within block combined logical . Multiple blocks combined logical . allows creating complex filter expressions like: (Condition1 Condition2) (Condition3 Condition4) apply filtering across multiple datasets, users can instantiate multiple instances module, configured different dataset. module call independent manages filters specific dataset. Supported Data Types & Expressions: Supports filtering character, factor, numeric columns. Conditions can use operators: ==, !=, <, >, <=, >=. Conditions specified simple expressions, e.g., columnA == 'value' columnB != 5 columnC >= 10 block's conditions combined . Multiple blocks combined . Features: Add Multiple Blocks: Dynamically add new blocks alternative conditions. Add Conditions: Within block, add multiple conditions, duplicate prevention. Preview Filter Expression: Generate display current combined filter expression. Remove Conditions: Remove individual conditions within block. Expression Generation: resulting expression can directly used dplyr::filter() similar functions. Usage Pattern: Call module multiple times different dataset names filter multiple datasets independently. call manages filter state expression. Users can build complex filters per dataset apply combine needed.

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: dataname (character(1)) Name dataset filter. Pass single dataset name string.

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: teal::teal_transform_module

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
code: app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris),   modules = teal::modules(teal::example_module(     transformators = list(or_filtering_transformator("IRIS"))   )) ) if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }
